Package de.cocolab.reuse

Useful classes for building compilers using the Cocktail tool kit.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
Comparable This interface specifies an ordering on the objects of each class that implements it.
HasPosition This interface specifies a position method which returns an object of type Position.
 

Class Summary
CocktailReader Read formatted representations of objects from a text stream.
CocktailWriter Print formatted representations of objects to a text stream.
DynArrayBoolean Dynamic flexible arrays of element type boolean.
DynArrayByte Dynamic flexible arrays of element type byte.
DynArrayChar Dynamic flexible arrays of element type char.
DynArrayDouble Dynamic flexible arrays of element type double.
DynArrayFloat Dynamic flexible arrays of element type float.
DynArrayInt Dynamic flexible arrays of element type int.
DynArrayLong Dynamic flexible arrays of element type long.
DynArrayObject Dynamic flexible arrays of arbitrary element type.
DynArrayShort Dynamic flexible arrays of element type short.
Errors Error message collections.
General General functionality, static methods.
Global This class provides a convenient way to have one global instance of each of Errors and IdentTable for simple Cocktail applications.
Ident A string interpreted as an Identifier.
IdentTable Identifier tables.
Position Representation of positions consisting of line and column numbers.
Set Set of int.
Sort Utility class for sorting arrays of objects.
TestDataGenerator Test data generation.
 

Exception Summary
CocktailError This exception is thrown if an internal inconsistency or system problem is detected.
FatalError This exception is thrown when a fatal error is reported to an instance of Errors.
MaskedException This exception is thrown to mask another exception which would normally have to be listed in a throws clause.
 

Package de.cocolab.reuse Description

Useful classes for building compilers using the Cocktail tool kit.

Some of these classes are required by Cocktail generated code, while others are independent components which have been found to be useful. Similar code is available in other languages supported by Cocktail, and compatibility with those sometimes prevents the use of Java naming conventions.

The classes are grouped as follows:

Dynamic Arrays
In Java the size of arrays is specified when the array object is created. Cocktail provides classes which can be used when the required size of an array is not known in advance. One class is provided for each basic type, for example DynArrayByte or DynArrayObject.
Identifiers
Identifiers may be mapped to instances of Ident using an IdentTable. Ident objects are unique for a given input string, and are also numbered to give a convenient index into an array of identifier attributes.
Error reporting
The Errors class is needed by parsers generated with the parser generator lark. It can also be used to report error messages found during scanning or semantic analysis.
Position
The class Position is a simple representation of the position of tokens in a source file consisting of fields for line and column. This class can be subclassed or tailored to the user's needs, if necessary, for example to include the file name.
IO
The classes CocktailReader and CocktailWriter provide input-output formatting facilities for Cocktail specific objects.
